text.*:
United States at the
Deaflympics
IPC code USA
NPC USA Deaf Sports Federation
Website www.usdeafsports.org
Medals
Ranked 1st
Gold
355
Silver
310
Bronze
338
Total
1,003

The United States has been participating at the Deaflympics from 1924 and it is also currently placed first in the all time Deaflympics medal list. US has won more than 1000 medals,the only nation to do so in Deaflympics.[1]

USA has been participating at the Winter Deaflympics from 1987.

Contents

  • 1 Medal tallies
    • 1.1 Summer Deaflympics
    • 1.2 Winter Deaflympics
  • 2 Notable achievements
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References
  • 5 External links

Winter Deaflympics[edit]

This article is incomplete. Please help to improve it, or discuss the issue on the talk page. (August 2017)
Event Gold Silver Bronze Total
1967 2 0 0 2

Notable achievements[edit]

  • In the 1977 Summer Deaflympics held in Sweden, Jeff Float of US won 10 gold medals in Swimming,which is still considered as a unique and unprecedented record in Deaflympics history[2]
  • Reed Gershwind holds the record for winning the most number of medals for United States in the Deaflympics history with 30 medals.This medal tally is also the second highest for any deaflympian just behind Terence Parkin of South Africa.[3]

  • United States at the Paralympics
  • United States at the Olympics

  2. ^ "Jeff Float | Deaflympics". www.deaflympics.com. Retrieved 2017-08-30. 
  3. ^ "Reed Gershwind | Deaflympics". www.deaflympics.com. Retrieved 2017-09-04.
